bidi_characters.name: LRE (Left-to-Right Embedding)
bidi_characters.relevance: Can be used to start a segment of code that will be visually reversed.

bidi_characters.name: LRO (Left-to-Right Override)
bidi_characters.description: Forces subsequent characters to be displayed left-to-right.
bidi_characters.relevance: Key character for reversing the visual order of a block of text.

bidi_characters.name: PDF (Pop Directional Formatting)
bidi_characters.description: Ends the effect of an embedding or override.
bidi_characters.relevance: Necessary to close the Bidi context after the reversed content.

bidi_characters.name: RLE (Right-to-Left Embedding)
bidi_characters.relevance: Used to initiate a right-to-left context for reversal.

bidi_characters.name: RLO (Right-to-Left Override)
bidi_characters.description: Forces subsequent characters to be displayed right-to-left.
bidi_characters.relevance: Core mechanism for visually anagramming source code (Trojan Source).

bidi_characters.name: FSI (First Strong Isolate)
bidi_characters.description: Starts an isolate embedding whose direction is determined by the first strong character.
bidi_characters.relevance: Provides a more contained method for applying Bidi transformations.

bidi_characters.name: PDI (Pop Directional Isolate)
bidi_characters.description: Ends the effect of an isolate embedding.
bidi_characters.relevance: Closes the isolate context started by FSI.

zero_width_characters.name: ZERO WIDTH NON-JOINER (ZWNJ)
zero_width_characters.purpose: Interferes with string matching, token fragmentation

zero_width_characters.name: SOFT HYPHEN
zero_width_characters.purpose: Can be invisible or conditionally visible

language_vulnerabilities.name: Python
language_vulnerabilities.bidi_vulnerability: High (confined to comments/strings, but still exploitable)
language_vulnerabilities.homoglyph_vulnerability: Very High (due to permissive identifiers and NFKC normalization)
language_vulnerabilities.zero_width_vulnerability: High (can fragment tokens, used in steganography)
language_vulnerabilities.nfkc_normalization_impact: Identifiers are NFKC normalized, leading to vast numbers of visually distinct but functionally identical identifiers (PEP 672).
language_vulnerabilities.unicode_escape_abuse: High (can hide punctuation, commands within strings via `unicode_escape` encoding).
language_vulnerabilities.notes: Asymmetry between parse-time normalization and editor rendering.

language_vulnerabilities.name: JavaScript
language_vulnerabilities.homoglyph_vulnerability: Very High (permissive identifiers in ES2015+ allows non-Latin chars, e.g., Katakana in `puppeteer-extra-plugin-adblock`).
language_vulnerabilities.permissive_identifiers: Allows wide range of Unicode characters (Annex #31) in identifiers.

language_vulnerabilities.name: Java
language_vulnerabilities.homoglyph_vulnerability: High (JLS permits any 'Java letter' including non-Latin scripts in identifiers).
language_vulnerabilities.permissive_identifiers: Allows extensive Unicode characters in identifiers.
language_vulnerabilities.unicode_escape_abuse: High (compile-time processing of `\uXXXX` escapes provides trivial obfuscation).

language_vulnerabilities.name: Rust
language_vulnerabilities.homoglyph_vulnerability: Mitigated (proactive patches for CVE-2021-42574 and CVE-2021-42694)
language_vulnerabilities.notes: One of the first ecosystems to respond proactively to Trojan Source.

language_vulnerabilities.name: C/C++/C#
language_vulnerabilities.homoglyph_vulnerability: High (depending on compiler and standard version)
language_vulnerabilities.notes: General susceptibility to Trojan Source due to universal Unicode standard.
